values.title: Data Analyst
values.summary: Mindshare WorldWide is a global media agency, part of WPP Group.

description.text: Primarily a data analysis and reporting role for the American Express account, driven by Excel, SQL Server and Python.

values.title: BI Developer
values.summary: Rated People is an online marketplace connecting homeowners and tradespeople throughout the UK.

description.text: Migrating business intelligence away from MS Office applications by developing and maintaining a code base in python that automated all non-web based reports to the business
Managing several complex dashboards in Excel using data from internal databases on active users, sales, jobs posted and much more
Improved performance by removing slow MS Access/Excel stages in the BI reporting pipeline where possible, by writing efficient SQL queries embedded in python scripts
Developed a user-friendly interactive dashboard in d3.js, showing vital information to the business and helping insight to circulate amongst non-technical colleagues
Deployed a random forest model to predict customer churn on a monthly basis

values.title: Data Scientist
values.summary: Charles River Associates (CRA) is a leading global consulting firm that offers business, financial, and economic consulting services to major law firms, corporations, and governments around the world.

description.text: Leading a sub-team of up to two other data scientists, supporting a wider group of 60+ economic consultants in the European Competition Practice with ongoing casework.
Working on a number of high-profile retail mergers, including:
Analysis typically involves anticipating theories of harm in the context of the litigation - local overlap, entry & exit, price modelling analyses are common in retail mergers.
Extremely fast-paced environment, a significant proportion of ad-hoc, exploratory analysis
Built & maintained end-to-end data pipelines from databases or other storage methods to final analysis across multiple workstreams & cases Data occasionally large (108+ rows).
Managed ArcGIS software and most geospatial analysis, plus various other technology functions
Played an evangelical role in supporting the company to use modern computing practices, provided training to colleagues worldwide covering python, ArcGIS, Excel, data visualisation and web scraping
Built extensive core infrastructure in python including:
subText: Software to process the calculation of millions of driving times per hour
Automated map generation API with ArcPy & ArcGIS, saving hundreds of hours of consultant time
Generalised & customised WSS & Fascia Count calculators for a vast array of scenarios based on regulatory precedents
Google Maps API connector using asyncio + aiohttp

values.title: React Developer
values.summary: Decathlon is a global sporting goods retailer with a presence in nearly 50 countries worldwide.

description.text: Solely responsible for the entire build and delivery of a interactive business intelligence dashboard application (“Playbook”)
Designed to make Decathlon’s data more accessible to store managers, sport leaders and other stakeholders throughout the business.
Modern web development tools such as React, D3, Node, GraphQL, Python and MongoDB used throughouts

values.title: Data Engineer
values.summary: Infinity Works is one of the UK's leading digital transformation and engineering consultancies, delivering value in large technology-led projects in a variety of sectors including government, retail, energy, and financial services.

description.text: Assisted a team to migrate a system of some 160+ data pipelines, shifting several TB/day of data orchestrated by cron to being scheduled using an airflow cluster.
Supporting other teams reliant on this legacy system, fixing ongoing issues, weighing heavily on a variety of AWS services such as ECS, EMR, Athena, Redshift and more.

A green-field project, worked within a team to build a developer compliance tool to help senior stakeholders understand developer maturity and best practices amongst engineering teams globally, from proof-of-concept stage all the way to a fully scalable application.
This was achieved using Azure Data Factory, SQL Server and Power BI, deployable via a CI/CD pipeline using Azure DevOps and ARM templates.
My focus was on the data lifecycle, designing and building the data model and database, and visualising the output in Power BI.

values.summary: Like most software engineers I meet, I've got a lot of side projects, and far more that have been started than have been finished. However, my inbox is always open and I'd love to hear from anyone looking to collaborate.
